headline: Love Isn’t Always Steady—But It Can Be Safe
body: ADHD doesn’t block intimacy—but it does require emotional tools, clear rituals, and more grace for the waves.
prompt: What emotional need in your relationships could you name with more clarity and compassion this week?

headline: Stuck Isn’t Lazy—It’s a Signal
body: If you’re frozen, it’s not failure—it’s executive overload. Start small. Start kind. But start.
prompt: What’s one micro-action you can take today to tell your brain it’s safe to begin again?

headline: It’s Not Lazy—It’s Chemistry
body: Motivation isn’t moral. It’s neurochemical. And there are ways to work with it instead of fighting yourself.
prompt: What’s one dopamine-supporting habit you could build into your morning or work time?

headline: You're Not Too Much—You're Overstimulated
body: Emotional swings don’t mean you're broken—they mean you're deeply wired to care. But you can learn to steer the wave.
prompt: What part of you panics at rejection—and what could you say to calm it down today?

headline: You're Not Broken—You're Flooded
body: ADHD doesn’t just distract. It amplifies. And the fix isn’t force—it’s regulation, rhythm, and radical gentleness.
prompt: What recent shame spike could you meet with compassion instead of critique this week?
